How to Get Voter Data in Virginia

How to Get Voter Data in Virginia

November 17, 2025 virginia voter-data voter-list voter-history

Virginia provides access to voter registration data and voter history at an exceptionally affordable rate of $9.50 per million records. However, access requires meeting eligibility requirements such as being a candidate, political party, or PAC, with a verification process to confirm qualification.

Quick Summary

Category Details
Statewide Cost $9.50 per million records
Voter List Access Online form with verification
Voter History Access Included with voter list
Delivery Method Contact ELECT for delivery details
Processing Time After verification and approval
Eligibility Candidate, Party, PAC, or other qualified entity

Eligibility Requirements

Virginia restricts access to voter registration data to qualified requestors who meet specific criteria.

Who Can Access

Eligible requestors include:

  • Candidates for elective office
  • Political parties
  • Political Action Committees (PACs)
  • Other qualified entities as defined by Virginia law

Verification Process

Virginia conducts a verification process to confirm requestors meet eligibility requirements before providing access to voter data.

Voter List

Virginia provides voter registration data through the Department of Elections’ Client Services division.

How to Access

  1. Visit the Virginia Client Services page
  2. Review eligibility requirements
  3. Fill out the request form (available on the page)
  4. Submit the form for verification
  5. Department of Elections will verify you meet eligibility criteria (Candidate, Party, PAC, etc.)
  6. Upon approval, pay the fee ($9.50 per million records)
  7. Receive voter registration data

What’s Included

The voter registration file includes information for registered voters in Virginia.

Voter History

Virginia includes voter history data with the voter registration list when requested.

How to Access

When submitting your request form, indicate that you want voter history included with the voter registration data.

Historical Coverage

Contact the Department of Elections or review information provided during the request process for details about the historical coverage period included in the voter history file.

Cost

Virginia offers some of the most affordable voter data in the United States:

Pricing: $9.50 per million records

Records Cost
1,000,000 $9.50
2,000,000 $19.00
3,000,000 $28.50
4,000,000 $38.00
~6,000,000 (statewide est.) ~$57.00

For Virginia’s estimated 6 million registered voters, the total cost for statewide data with voter history would be approximately $57, making it one of the least expensive states for comprehensive voter information.

Restrictions and Permitted Uses

Eligibility Verification Required:

Virginia verifies that requestors meet eligibility requirements (Candidate, Party, PAC, etc.) before providing access to voter registration data.

When requesting Virginia voter data, eligible requestors must comply with state laws regarding the use of voter registration records. The Department of Elections will provide specific terms of use and legal requirements during the verification and approval process.

Technical Notes

Outstanding Value

At $9.50 per million records, Virginia offers exceptional value:

  • Statewide data: ~$57 estimated
  • Voter history included
  • One of the lowest costs in the nation
  • Comparable to Arkansas ($2.50), Michigan ($23-$50), and Missouri ($35)

Verification Process

Virginia’s verification process ensures:

  • Data is accessed by eligible entities only
  • Proper use for political and election purposes
  • Compliance with state law
  • Accountability for data use

Be prepared to provide:

  • Proof of candidate status
  • PAC registration documentation
  • Political party credentials
  • Other eligibility verification

Per-Million Pricing

The per-million-records pricing is unusual but transparent:

  • Calculate exact costs based on records needed
  • Scalable for different geographic areas
  • No hidden fees
  • Minimal cost even for statewide data

Online Form

Virginia uses an online request form system rather than mail-in requests, providing:

  • Faster submission
  • Easy tracking
  • Electronic communication
  • Streamlined process

Testing Status

This system has not been independently tested. Recommended approach:

  1. Confirm Eligibility:
    • Review requirements carefully
    • Ensure you qualify as Candidate, Party, PAC, etc.
    • Gather documentation proving eligibility
  2. Contact Client Services:
    • Email or call before submitting form
    • Ask about verification process
    • Confirm current pricing
    • Understand timeline
  3. Submit Request:
    • Complete online form accurately
    • Provide verification documentation
    • Specify voter history inclusion
    • Wait for verification approval
  4. After Approval:
    • Pay required fee
    • Confirm delivery method
    • Understand file format
    • Verify what’s included

Contact Information

Virginia Department of Elections - Client Services

  • Website: https://www.elections.virginia.gov/
  • Client Services: Information Page

Virginia’s voter data system offers exceptional value at $9.50 per million records, with an estimated total cost of around $57 for complete statewide data with voter history. While access requires meeting eligibility criteria and passing verification as a Candidate, Party, PAC, or other qualified entity, the minimal cost makes Virginia one of the most affordable states for qualified requestors to obtain comprehensive voter registration and participation data.
